attributes.action: make EMA (education maintenance allowance) £50 a week instead of £30
attributes.background: as a student, EMA helps me at school for costs of school supplies, uniform and clothing, and £30 is barely enough to cover half the costs of these items. Like me, there are similar pupils in my position who require EMA to cover all aspects of their living; food, helping out with home bills.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish, Welsh or Northern Ireland Governments are responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.  

The Scottish Parliament and Welsh Assembly have their own Petitions Committees. If you'd like to send your petition there, you can find out more here:

http://www.assembly.wales/en/gethome/e-petitions/Pages/e-petitions.aspx
http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

If you'd like to send your petition to the Northern Ireland Assembly, you can find the contact details here:

http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/about-the-assembly/contact-us/
